name: Hotel California Paris Champs Elysees

reviews.text: Hotel is in a great location in the Champs Elysee and the street had some lovely wee shops (and yes, there were some 'interesting' clubs near by but they did not affect us.)
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms, well, seem to vary greatly when comparing notes with my colleagues. Room was a good size but tired and the room I had was shower only - great shower but luke warm water every time I used it (and my colleagues mentioned the same.)
reviews.title: DUMP & SEEDY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bar was very expensive and service was slow but charming at the same time! Little things peeve in a 4 star hotel, like that there is no room service between 3 & 7?
reviews.title: Great Location...great rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, would stay here again, but it would be very much dependent on it being at a very good rate.
reviews.title: Nothing to complain about

reviews.text: Don't waste your money, employees rude, lie, area is dark and seedy. The hotel does not deserve guests, if you are American for get it!
reviews.title: Listen to the poor reviews...I wish I did...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel California over Chistmas. The room was a nice size. Very clean. The location could not be beat. It is two blocks off the Champs Elyesses (sp). The beds are comfortable albeit a bit firm. The breakfast was very good. We got a 2 for 1 deal on the breakfast so some people may think 25 euros per person a bit high. The front desk staff were very helpful and always greeted us leaving and returning. We would definitely not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends. We got a great rate on a promotion on the hotel website.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in an excellent location

reviews.text: This was my 3rd stay at Hotel California. The breakfast was really, really overpriced even though it is buffet. The room was very big and spacious. The bathroom was very nice. My friend and I had trouble getting the maids to leave enough towels for two people. They couldn't understand/speak English, my French is very limited. So we had trouble getting towels. But this was minor. And the bellman and the bartender were wonderful guys who made us forget any inconveniences we experienced. The front desk staff was very courteous and helpful. I had a bad experience at this hotel in March 2006 and I was reluctant to stay there again. I am glad I did. I was not disappointed. The location ain't bad, either.
reviews.title: 3rd Time's the Charm

reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. We were so impressed by the hotel staff. They were very welcoming and friendly from the start. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Staff very welcoming and helpful. Brilliant location.

reviews.text: Stayed 1 night for business and had a terrible experience. Got a nice renovated room on the 4th floor but looks can be deceiving. Woke up with blotchy skin on ears, neck, and arms, which looked and felt like insect bites. When I told hotel staff about my unfortunate experience with bed bugs in the room they told me it couldn't happen in their hotel since they spray every 3 months. They didn't even offer a discount or any compensation. Back in the UK I went to see a doctor to make sure it wasn't anything more serious, he confirmed bed bugs as most likely cause. My advice is to stay away from Hotel California in Paris...
reviews.title: Luxury hotel with bed bugs...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hated the name of this hotel...it's in paris, for goodness sakes!! But this is a wonderful hotel. Everything from the rooms, to the breakfast, to the staff and service were magnificent.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel

reviews.text: No wifi, no ironing (you have to go to their smelly ironing room), poor sound proofing, deco looks awful, good location but won't return.
reviews.title: Not for business

reviews.text: Very nice and charming hotel close to Champs Elysees (as the name says).
reviews.title: Charming, old classic hotel.

reviews.text: The room I had felt old, the door was a bit thin and I could easily hear other guests when they talked in the hall outside.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms and location

reviews.text: The air condition was very noisy so I had to switch it off, not that I really needed it in October but if you stay here in the middle of the summer this is definitely something you should take into account.
reviews.title: Nice Europen Hotel with GREAT location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was great, just a few minutes walk from Champs Elysees and about 10 minutes from the Arc de Triomp.
reviews.title: Huge difference between 2006 and 2010 !!

reviews.text: We were traveling with a group meeting in Paris for a reunion weekend. This was the perfect location for us as there are 2 metro lines just minutes from the hotel -- shopping, sightseeing and nightlife were all within easy reach by foot or train. Rue de Berri is not the prettiest street in Paris but the location is very convenient.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in the Champs Elysees area

reviews.text: The hotel itself is charming and the staff were very helpful. The hotel is decorated with a lot of artwork and there is a nice courtyard with a fountain. The rates are reasonable compared to many nearby hotels and this hotel is more personal than most. The rooms vary in size. It's worth paying the extra for a "deluxe" room. Confirm your room type while checking in to make sure you are getting the right room. The rooms are not fancy, but offer everything you need for a comfortable stay. Although we had a room facing the street below, the windows are well insulated and we were not bothered by any street noise.
reviews.title: Very classy hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast room was a perfect place to meet up in the mornings (the extensive buffet of hot and cold items was great) and the bar was a cozy place to meet in the evenings before going to dinner. There is also a fitness room but none of us had time to use it.
reviews.title: Good Tourism Location But Showing its Age

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a cozy boutique hotel in the Champs Elysees area.
reviews.title: Rooms need updating, beds not so...

reviews.text: We loved this hotel, it was beautiful, luxurious, classy. Our rooms were a good size and had a lovely character to it from the 1920's. They had all kinds of art work hanging in the halls, unfortunantly some people had decided to slash a few of them for kicks I guess, no class! The breakfast was okay but wasn't worth the price they charged, if we stayed there again I would go elsewhere for a breakfast but still, it was tasty.
reviews.title: Expensive for what you get

description: Built in 1925, this Haussmanian style building has been the favourite luxury hotel of the American press and Hollywood Stars. More than just a hotel, this is an authentic art gallery for all art lovers with its private collection of over 3000 oils and lithographs. With its fine sense of luxury, this 4 star hotel has been turned into a fine family mansion just a step away from the Champs Elysées and belongs to the « Hotels du Roy » group.
